After external skin damage, the organism needs to repair itself quickly to avoid dehydration, blood loss and the entrance of harmful microorganisms. Thus a wound healing process initiates and involves an intrinsic and coordinated cascade of events divided into 3 phases: inflammation, formation of granulation tissue and maturation
6â€“ 8 . The process is orchestrated by different cell types such as platelets, neutrophils, macrophages, endothelial cells and fibroblasts, as well as protein (cytokines, growth factors) and lipid (prostaglandins, leukotrienes, thromboxanes and lipoxins) mediators
9 .
